conversations.description: User submits a chocolate chip cookie recipe; the app returns a compliant label with calories, fat, sugar, and a QR code linking to the full instructions.
Home baker inputs a gluten‑free banana bread recipe and requests allergen statements; the label highlights “Contains: None” and lists added nutrients.
Food startup uploads a small‑batch salsa formula, specifies 2 tbsp serving size, and receives a label with sodium, vitamin C, and a printable PDF.
User provides a raw ingredient list for vegan protein bars, asks for a “high‑protein” claim; the app calculates 20 g protein per serving and validates claim eligibility.
A chef inputs a seasonal pumpkin soup recipe, wants the label in metric units, and receives a PDF with serving size in grams.
User uploads a recipe that includes “1 pinch of salt”; the system normalizes the quantity, includes sodium content, and rounds per FDA rules.
Food‑tech entrepreneur needs a label for a new keto snack; the app verifies that total carbs are under 5 g per serving and adds a “Low Carb” statement.
User inputs a recipe with “2 cups of melted butter”; the system converts to grams, calculates total saturated fat, and flags high‑fat warning.
A bakery owner wants to print labels for 12‑inch loaves; the app generates a landscape‑oriented PDF with a large barcode for inventory tracking.
Home cook uploads a homemade granola recipe, asks for “organic” ingredient verification; the label includes an organic certification note where applicable.
User provides a recipe that uses “sweetener equivalent to 1 cup sugar”; the app translates to grams of sweetener, adjusts calories, and updates the label.
A craft soda maker inputs ingredients for a ginger‑lemon drink, requests caffeine content; the label shows 0 mg caffeine and includes a “Caffeine‑Free” claim.
User wants a label for a low‑sodium broth; the app calculates total sodium, rounds to the nearest 5 mg, and validates the “Reduced Sodium” claim.
Small batch chocolate maker uploads a recipe with cocoa nibs and wants a “Contains: Soy” allergen label; the system flags soy lecithin and adds the statement.
A dietitian inputs a meal‑prep recipe for 4 servings, asks for per‑serving breakdown; the label displays nutrients per 1 serving and total per batch.
User provides a raw list with “3 large eggs”; the system converts to grams, calculates cholesterol, and includes it on the label per FDA format.
Food entrepreneur wants a label for a sugar‑free jam; the app confirms zero grams of total sugars and adds a “No Added Sugars” claim.
Customer uploads a recipe with homemade almond milk; the system calculates calcium added via fortification and reflects it on the label.
User asks for a bilingual label (English/Spanish) for a taco seasoning mix; the app generates PDF with side‑by‑side translations.
Home baker wants a label for a gluten‑free blueberry muffin, specifying “1 muffin (45 g)”; the app rounds nutrients accordingly and validates serving size format.
A startup needs a label for a new protein shake, requesting “Vitamin D 100 % DV”; the app ensures the nutrient meets the daily value threshold.
User supplies a recipe for a spicy peanut sauce, asks for a “Contains: Peanuts” allergen warning; the label includes the warning and calculates total fat.
A coffee shop wants a label for a cold brew concentrate; the app calculates caffeine per serving and adds it to the nutrition facts.
User inputs a recipe that calls for “½ cup olive oil”; the system converts to grams, includes total monounsaturated fat, and applies rounding rules.
Food blogger wants a printable label for a vegan lasagna, with a QR code linking to the blog post; the PDF includes the QR and all mandatory fields.
A hobbyist brews a kombucha; the app calculates residual sugar, alcohol content (if any), and creates a label complying with FDA non‑alcoholic beverage rules.
User asks for a label for a low‑calorie frozen dessert, ensuring it meets “Calorie‑Reduced” claim criteria; the app validates < 100 kcal per serving.
A small dairy producer uploads a cheese recipe, wants to list “Calcium %DV”; the system calculates calcium content and adds the percentage.
Home cook provides a recipe with “2 tbsp honey”; the app converts to grams, includes natural sugars, and displays them under total sugars.
User wants a label for a pre‑packed salad kit, including “Contains: Tree Nuts”; the system scans ingredient list and adds the allergen statement.
A vegan bakery owner inputs a coconut‑cream frosting recipe, asks for “Trans Fat 0 g” claim; the app verifies zero trans fat and adds appropriate notation.
Food‑product developer uploads a recipe for a fortified energy bar, wants vitamin B12 included; the label shows 200 % DV for B12.
User provides a recipe with ambiguous ingredient “spicy sauce”; the app prompts clarification, then calculates sodium and calories after clarification.
A nonprofit cooking project needs labels for a low‑fat vegetable soup, requesting “Reduced Fat” claim; the app checks total fat < 3 g per serving.
Home baker wants a label for a lemon tart, asks for “Contains: Citrus” allergen note; the system adds a custom statement for citrus allergens.
User uploads a gluten‑free pancake mix formula, requests ingredient order for label; the app returns a formatted ingredient list per FDA rule.
A snack company wants a label for a baked kale chip, including “Vitamin A %DV”; the app calculates vitamin A based on kale content.
User asks for a multi‑serving label for a casserole that feeds 8, with per‑serving breakdown; the PDF shows both total batch and per‑serving values.
Food startup needs a label for a shelf‑stable sauce, wants a “Best When Used By” date field; the app adds the date field and formats it correctly.
Home cook provides a recipe with “1 pinch of cinnamon”; the system treats the pinch as 0.5 g, includes trace amounts of sodium and sugar.
User wants a label for an artisanal granola bar with “No Artificial Flavors”; the app verifies ingredient list contains no artificial flavors and adds claim.
A beverage company asks for a label for a vitamin‑infused water, requesting “Calories 0”; the app confirms zero calories and formats the label accordingly.
User inputs a recipe for a dairy‑free ice cream, wants a “Contains: Soy” allergen statement; the system identifies soy milk and adds the warning.
Small bakery wants a label for a cinnamon roll, with “Total Carbohydrate 30 g”; the app calculates carbs and validates the rounding rule.
User provides a recipe for a low‑sugar jam, asks for “≤ 5 g Sugar per Serving” claim; the app checks sugar content and confirms eligibility.
Food entrepreneur uploads a recipe for a keto pizza crust, requests the label to highlight “Net Carbs 2 g”; the system calculates net carbs and includes them.
Home maker wants a printable label for a batch of homemade ketchup, including “Sodium %DV”; the app computes sodium percentage of daily value.
User asks for a label for a protein‑rich mushroom stir‑fry, with “Iron %DV”; the system calculates iron from mushrooms and adds the percentage.
A health‑coach wants a label for a detox soup, requesting “Fiber %DV”; the app calculates dietary fiber and includes the DV percentage.
User provides a recipe using “2 cups powdered milk”; the system converts to grams, adds calcium, and reflects it on the nutrition facts.
Food startup needs a label for a gluten‑free pasta, with “Calories per 100 g”; the app formats the label to show calories per 100 g as optional.
